{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3573564,"name":"Tomer Danielli","username":"Tomerul","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e9bcb4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-30T14:33:37.197Z","cooked":"

We’ve recently had a kraken start putting out smoke, needless to say it stopped working too. This adds to a long list of problems we’ve had with krakens. We’ve had a kraken stop working despite the talon signaling that it’s receiving current. We’ve had 2 krakens suddenly start outputting significantly less torque. Has anyone else had any of these problems?

174334517270560930475140137488261920×2560 227 KB

Are you current limiting these?

We run Krakens and have had zero issues due to properly setting current limits.

We have also had zero problems with the krakens. It is odd that you would have so very many issues with different krakens.

What is the damage around the L and O in the name “talon”?

Are you using the correct CTRE torque wrench?

Are you using the correct length screw on the terminals?

We experienced this, and the issue was that the bolts were overtorqued. Make sure you get torque wrenches that are rated the right torque (CTRE and WCP sells ones specifically for the Kraken)
